forecast.name: Independence Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West wind around 23 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 52. West wind 15 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

weather_report:
In the heart of Downtown San Francisco, the night unfolds under a canopy of stars, the air crisp and cool as the city breathes with a gentle sigh of the Pacific’s embrace. After a sunny Independence Day, when warmth met the laughter of locals, the temperature settles predictably into the low fifties, with a steady west wind whispering through the streets, softening any residual heat from the day’s festivities. What appears as a clear night is punctuated by the remnants of the sea's low-lying fog, teasingly lingering along the edges of the horizon—a ballet between clarity and mystery, perfect for a reflective evening stroll.

As dawn breaks on this delightful summer day, expect a return to the sun’s radiant glow, illuminating the city with soft light. Though daytime temperatures promise to hover around the comfortable low sixties, the brisk winds may remind you that San Francisco never relinquishes its coastal signature entirely. For those venturing out, layering will be essential: a light sweater or jacket will serve as a companion against the refreshing gusts while allowing you to indulge in the day’s warmth as it unfolds. This weather invites moments of tranquility, perhaps at a café where you can sip a warm drink and watch the world go by, or a leisurely walk along the Embarcadero, where the shimmering bay meets the bustling city—a perfect blend of serenity and life on this beautiful July day.
